metadata.Description: Renewable energy generated from sources located in bodies of water, such as wind farms or tidal power plants.

level 1.Description: Offshore renewable energy implements building standards that promote the use of sustainable energy sources and technologies.
Offshore renewable energy funds research and development projects to advance the use of sustainable energy technologies.
Offshore renewable energy focuses on harnessing wave energy as a sustainable energy source.
Offshore renewable energy operates in the marine environment to harness sustainable energy from wind, waves, and tides.
Offshore renewable energy partners with environmental organizations to ensure sustainable practices and minimize environmental impact.
Offshore renewable energy contributes to climate change mitigation by reducing greenhouse gas emissions and dependence on fossil fuels.
Offshore renewable energy monitors its environmental impact to ensure sustainable operations and minimize harm to marine ecosystems.
Offshore renewable energy targets increased renewable energy generation to meet sustainable energy goals and reduce reliance on non-renewable sources.

level 2.Subject: wind energy
level 2.Description: Wind energy implements Energy Efficiency Policy by promoting the use of energy-saving designs and materials.

level 2.Subject: wind energy
level 2.Description: Wind energy funds Research and Development to improve wind turbine efficiency and develop new technologies.

level 2.Subject: regional energy organizations
level 2.Description: Regional energy organizations implement energy efficiency policies to promote sustainable energy practices.

level 2.Subject: regional energy organizations
level 2.Description: Regional energy organizations focus on improving energy access in underserved areas to ensure equitable distribution of sustainable energy resources.

level 2.Subject: environmental impact assessments
level 2.Description: Environmental impact assessments align with environmental regulations to ensure compliance and minimize the negative environmental impacts of energy projects.

level 2.Subject: renewable energy agencies
level 2.Description: Renewable energy agencies employ experts in the field of renewable energy to drive innovation and promote the adoption of clean energy technologies.

level 2.Subject: renewable energy agencies
level 2.Description: Renewable energy agencies collaborate with research institutions to advance scientific knowledge and develop new technologies for renewable energy generation.

level 3.Subject: energy efficiency
level 3.Description: Energy efficiency measures address energy waste by promoting the use of energy-efficient technologies and practices.

level 3.Subject: renewable energy agencies
level 3.Description: Renewable energy agencies employ experts in the field of renewable energy to drive innovation and promote the adoption of clean energy technologies.

level 3.Subject: energy markets
level 3.Description: Energy markets address the issue of energy access by ensuring the availability and affordability of energy sources for all segments of society.

level 3.Subject: energy poverty indices
level 3.Description: Energy poverty indices implement energy access programs to provide affordable and reliable energy services to underserved communities.
